faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
In this course you will undertake a software development project in teams of four students. The project will give you hands-on exposure to contemporary software development practices and infrastructure, including rapid iterative development, version control, collaborative planning,  issue tracking, test automation and continuous integration. You will be delivering software to a real customer with real requirements. Your task is to detail the requirements, create a plan and deliver accordingly. Your deliverables will be verified and validated both by the course organisers and the customer who proposed the project.
The course is delivered as a mixture of lectures, private consulting sessions with a mentor, team meetings and collaborative work.
description.et:
Tarkvara arendustöö praktiline sooritamine rühmatööna.
Projekti koostamine annab õppijale ettekujutuse kaasaegsest tarkvara arenduse praktikast ja infrastruktuurist, sealhulgas iteratiivsest arendusest, versiooni kontrollist, ühisplaneerimisest, automaattestimisest ja pidevast integratsioonist. Õppijad koostavad tarkvara reaalsele kliendile arvestades reaalseid nõudeid. Õppija ülesandeks on täpsustada nõudeid, luua plaan ja realiseerida vastav tarkvara. Töö tulemusi kontrollitakse nii kursuse juhendajate kui ka klientide poolt. Kursus koosneb loengutest, individuaalsetest konsultatsioonidest, meeskondade koosolekutest ja meeskonnatööst.

objectives.en: The objective of this course is to provide hands-on experience in carrying out software projects. It should help students putting theory into practice. After completing the course, student will be able to work in small software development team as a team member or a project manager, write necessary documentation, program and test software as well as make presentations.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda praktilisi kogemusi tarkvaraprojektide läbiviimisel ning aidata õpitud teooriat praktikas rakendada. Kursuse läbinud õppur on suuteline töötama väiksemas tarkvaraarendustiimis ning seda juhtima, koostama tarkvara projektis vajalikku dokumentatsiooni, tarkvara programmeerima ja testima ning esitlusi tegema.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, students will be able to demonstrate practical knowledge of:

independent_work.et: Students will undertake a software development project in teams. Requirements: https://courses.cs.ut.ee/

grade_preconditions.et:
Students will undertake a software development project in teams. The project will consist of four iterations. The work and deliverables of each iteration will be assessed based on specific criteria published on the course Website and according to the following point system:

    1st iteration - 10pt
    2nd iteration - 15pt
    3rd iteration - 25pt
    4th iteration - 32pt
    Intermediate demo - 5pt
    Final demo&project summary - 8pt
    Peer review - 5pt 
Detailed grading guidelines for each iteration are available on the relevant Webpage of the course.
The outcome will be a grade out of 100 that will be mapped to a grade between A and F using the standard University grading scale.
To pass the course, you must obtain a grade of E or above.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade will be calculated by adding the grades of the following:
    1st iteration - 10pt
    2nd iteration - 15pt
    3rd iteration - 25pt
    4th iteration - 32pt
    Intermediate demo - 5pt
    Final demo & project summary - 8pt
    Peer review - 5pt 
Detailed grading guidelines for each iteration are available on the relevant course Webpage.
The outcome will be a grade out of 100 that will be mapped to a grade  between A and F using the standard University grading scale.

debt_elimination.et:
Deadline extensions for deliverable are given under the following penalties:
    Up to 24 hours late: score is reduced by 20%
    24-48 hours late: scored is reduced by 40%
    48 hours late: 100% of the points deducted for the deliverable in question.
There is no option for a retake examination nor to submit project deliverables at a later date,

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
